channel.title: A Yellow Guard - idle speculation from a highly uninformed source
channel.description: A Yellow Guard - idle speculation from a highly uninformed source

item.title: All the terrible things Hillary Clinton has done - in one big list
item.description:
All the terrible things Hillary Clinton has done - in one big list

By DOVER, N.H. (MarketWatch) - I have a confession to make: I can't keep up. Am I supposed to hate Hillary Rodham Clinton because she's too left-wing, or too right-wing? Because she's too feminist, or not feminist enough? Because she's too clever a politician, or too clumsy?

item.title: Is Bernie Sanders the Ted Cruz of the Democrats?
item.description:
Is Bernie Sanders the Ted Cruz of the Democrats?

I want to give Bernie a fair shout, so I went to his website to see what are his proposals for reforming Wall Street. There are none (his "Too Big to Fail, Too Big to Exist Act" is a campaign slogan with the word 'bill' slapped on the cover. It's not serious). I wanted to see Bernie run long before he ever declared his candidacy, but the flimsiness of his policies concerns me. I am increasingly coming to the conclusion he is the Ted Cruz of the Democratic Party - good at channelling anger and pressing the base's buttons, but at the expense of offering unrealistically simple solutions to complex problems.

item.title: Three members of U.N. panel said Assange was 'arbitrarily detained.' One didn't. Here's his dissent.
item.description:
Three members of U.N. panel said Assange was 'arbitrarily detained.' One didn't. Here's his dissent.

A U.N. panel has declared that Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder who has remained confined within the Ecuadorian Embassy in London since 2012, is being "arbitrarily detained." The decision from the U.N.'s Working Group on Arbitrary Detention is not legally binding, though it carries significant weight.

item.title: A Yellow Guard / Outside In Podcast Episode 2
item.description:
A Yellow Guard / Outside In Podcast Episode 2

Analysis of the Republican Iowa caucus results and a look ahead to Iowa and the Democratic primary.

item.title: Ted Cruz's Ineligibility To Be President
item.description:
Ted Cruz's Ineligibility To Be President

At dinner last week with two friends, one of whom is a law professor, I blithely asserted that Ted Cruz was eligible to be President, and that no serious person believes that "natural-born citizen" excludes those who were entitled to U.S. citizenship at birth, even though born outside the United States, by virtue of having a U.S. citizen as a parent.

item.title: Outside In Podcast Feb 1 2015 by A Yellow Guard
item.description:
Outside In Podcast Feb 1 2015 by A Yellow Guard

The first Yellow Guard / Outside In podcast! We're talking the Iowa caucuses, Donald Trump and Ted Cruz.

item.title: Sophisticated Trump
item.description:
Sophisticated Trump

What if Donald Trump had elocution lessons? All words verbatim.
